results.title: Australian Aborigines: cooking
results.creator_credit: Australian Instructional Films and A.P. Elkin
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Modern social studies”.
Taken during the University of Sydney’s expedition to Arnhem Land, this film shows the traditional methods Aboriginals use to cook food.

results.title: Australian Aborigines: art, life and religion
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Modern social studies”.
A simple portrayal of the aborigines’ belief that the spirit world and the material world are very closely linked. The spiritual significance of painting their bodies, dancing and singing is explained. Taken during the University of Sydney’s expedition to Arnhem Land, led by Professor A. P. Elkin in 1952.

results.title: Australian [colour] Diary. No. 11
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine items: 1. Tony Rasky, caricaturist, gives some impressions of famous sporting personalities - Lew Hoad, Herb Elliot, Peter Thompson. 2. Wellington airport, another ground link in the airways of the sky, opens with a spectacular display of flying, and exhibition of aircraft.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 041. Sydney Opera House
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Roland Beckett and Shan Benson
results.brief_description: Progress report on the construction of the Opera House, with construction almost complete and fitting out well advanced. Includes views of the curtains of the sun and moon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Roland Beckett and Shan Benson

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 040. The Vintage
results.creator_credit: Australian news and Information Bureau, Film Australia, Frank Bagnall and Brian Hannant
results.brief_description: Reflects the growing industry of the Barossa Valley, in South Australia - one of Australia’s major wine producing areas. Settled by the Germans in the 1840’s, the valley has little towns of great charm. Around these early settlements, pioneers planted vines they had brought with them and many of their descendants continue to run family wineries. Photographed by Dean Semler.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian news and Information Bureau, Film Australia, Frank Bagnall and Brian Hannant

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 039
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Gil Brealey and Brian Hannant
results.brief_description: This episode of the popular cinemagazine entitled “A Ticket to Sydney” shows the workers of Sydney on their journeys to the city by all forms of transport at morning break hours. There is no commentary in this production.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 038. Asian road
results.brief_description: Illustrates a Colombo Plan scheme being carried out in Thailand. Australia is helping to build a highway which will eventually cross Asia and link Teheran with Saigon. Each senior Thai engineer or technician has an Australian counterpart to assist with training and execution. Shows the conditions and difficult terrain which must be crossed.

results.title: Australian [colour] diary. No. 035. Port Moresby
results.brief_description: A day in the life of Port Moresby, the capital city of Papua New Guinea. Shows early morning arrivals of fish, fruit and vegetables at the market, the flow of traffic into the city centre, the modern office buildings, indigenous buildings and artifacts, and finally people leaving work and relaxing on the beach.
